description: This option will install the OpenStack Mitaka packages using Ubuntu as a base operating system. There is alson an option to deploy Ceph cluster only. With high availability features built in, you are getting a robust, enterprise-grade OpenStack deployment.

restrictions.message: VMware vCenter not enabled for cluster
VMware vCenter datastore for images is not enabled in Settings tab

fields.label: CA file
fields.description: File containing the trusted CA bundle that emitted vCenter server certificate. If empty vCenters certificate is not verified.
fields.name: ca_file

availability.dpdkovs: 'experimental' in version:feature_groups and interface:pxe == false and interface:interface_properties.dpdk.enabled and not interface:interface_properties.sriov.enabled

name: Mitaka with Standalone Ceph on Ubuntu 14.04

ns_start: iptables -A INPUT -i <%INT%> -s <%CIDR%> -d <%IP%> -p tcp -m multiport --dports 6385,8080 -m state --state NEW -j ACCEPT
ns_stop: iptables -D INPUT -i <%INT%> -s <%CIDR%> -d <%IP%> -p tcp -m multiport --dports 6385,8080 -m state --state NEW -j ACCEPT

rule_to_pick_boot_disk.description: NVMe drives should be skipped as accessing such drives during the boot typically requires using UEFI which is still not supported by fuel-agent (it always installs BIOS variant of  grub). grub bug (http://savannah.gnu.org/bugs/?41883)
If we have /root on fake raid, then /boot partition should land on to it too. We can't proceed with grub-install otherwise.

compute-vmware.name: Compute VMware
compute-vmware.description: A node that runs nova-compute with VCDriver, that manages ESXi computing resources via VMware vCenter.

compute.name: Compute
compute.description: A Compute node creates, manages, and terminates virtual machine instances.

cinder-vmware.name: Cinder Proxy to VMware Datastore
cinder-vmware.description: Cinder-VMware provides scheduling of block storage resources delivered over VMware vCenter. Block storage can be used for database storage, expandable file systems, or providing a server with access to raw block level devices.

virt.name: Virtual
virt.description: ADVANCED: Make available possibilities to spawn vms on this node that can be assign as a normal nodes.

base-os.name: Operating System
base-os.description: Install base Operating System without additional packages and configuration.

controller.name: Controller

overrides.message: Neutron L3 HA requires at least 2 Controller nodes to function properly.

controller.description: The Controller initiates orchestration activities and provides an external API.  Other components like Glance (image storage), Keystone (identity management), Horizon (OpenStack dashboard) and Nova-Scheduler are installed on the controller as well.

restrictions.message: Ceph should be enabled in the environment settings.
restrictions.condition: settings:storage.volumes_ceph.value == false and settings:storage.images_ceph.value == false and settings:storage.ephemeral_ceph.value == false and settings:storage.objects_ceph.value == false

ceph-osd.name: Ceph OSD
ceph-osd.description: Ceph storage can be configured to provide storage for block volumes (Cinder), images (Glance) and ephemeral instance storage (Nova). It can also provide object storage through the S3 and Swift API (See settings to enable each).

restrictions.message: Ironic should be enabled in the environment settings.
Cinder LVM should be enabled in the environment settings.
Ceph RBD cannot be used with Cinder

cinder.name: Cinder
cinder.description: Cinder provides scheduling of block storage resources, typically delivered over iSCSI and other compatible backend storage systems. Block storage can be used for database storage, expandable file systems, or to provide a server with access to raw block level devices.

restrictions.message: Cinder Block Device driver should be enabled in the environment settings.
Ceph RBD cannot be used with Cinder Block Device

cinder-block-device.name: Cinder Block Device
cinder-block-device.description: Host node for Cinder Block Devices.

restrictions.message: Ceilometer should be enabled in the environment settings.
You are already using external MongoDB.

mongo.name: Telemetry - MongoDB

overrides.message: At most 1 MongoDB node can be added for non-HA deployment
At least 3 MongoDB nodes are recommended for HA deployment.

mongo.description: A feature-complete and recommended database for storage of metering data from OpenStack Telemetry (Ceilometer).

ha_compact.description: This configuration Deploys OpenStack ready for high availability (HA). Controller services are prepared for HA by setting up a base MySQL/Galera, RabbitMQ and HAProxy so that additional controllers can be deployed NOW, or scaled out LATER. 3 or more controllers are required for a true HA environment.

nova.description: Number of CPUs for Nova usage
nova.label: Nova CPU pinning

dpdk.description: Number of CPUs for DPDK usage
dpdk.label: DPDK CPU pinning

dpdk.description: DPDK Huge Pages per NUMA node in MB
dpdk.label: DPDK Huge Pages

repos.description:
Please note: the first repository will be considered the operating system mirror that will be used during node provisioning.
To create a local repository mirror on the Fuel master node, please follow the instructions provided by running "fuel-createmirror --help" on the Fuel master node.
Please make sure your Fuel master node has Internet access to the repository before attempting to create a mirror.

ceilometer.description: If selected, Ceilometer and Aodh components will be installed
ceilometer.label: Install Ceilometer and Aodh

restrictions.settings:additional_components.ceilomete: External Mongo aims to be an external backend for Ceilometer. Without Ceilometer enabled, External Mongo is useless and should not be installed.

mongo.description: If selected, You can use external Mongo DB as ceilometer backend
mongo.label: Use external Mongo DB

murano.description: If selected, Murano component will be installed
murano.label: Install Murano

murano-cfapi.description: If selected, Murano service broker will be installed
murano-cfapi.label: Install Murano service broker for Cloud Foundry

sahara.description: If selected, Sahara component will be installed
sahara.label: Install Sahara

restrictions.cluster:net_provider != 'neutron' or net: Ironic requires Neutron with VLAN segmentation.

restrictions.settings:storage.images_ceph.value == tr: Ironic requires Swift or RadosGW for Glance images.

ironic.description: If selected, Ironic component will be installed
ironic.label: Install Ironic

packages.label: Initial packages

neutron_qos.description: Enable Neutron QoS advanced service plug-in
neutron_qos.label: Neutron QoS

restrictions.message: Neutron DVR must be disabled in order to use Neutron L3 HA

neutron_l3_ha.description:
Enable High Availability features for Virtual Routers in Neutron
Requires at least 2 Controller nodes to function properly
neutron_l3_ha.label: Neutron L3 HA

restrictions.networking_parameters:segmentation_type: DVR requires L2 population to be enabled.

neutron_dvr.description: Enable Distributed Virtual Routers in Neutron
neutron_dvr.label: Neutron DVR

neutron_l2_pop.description: Enable L2 population mechanism in Neutron
neutron_l2_pop.label: Neutron L2 population

sudo.description: Sudoers configuration directives for operator user, one per line.
sudo.label: Sudoers configuration

authkeys.description: Public SSH keys to include to operator user's authorized keys, one per line.
authkeys.label: Authorized SSH keys

volumes_ceph.description: Configures Cinder to store volumes in Ceph RBD images.
volumes_ceph.label: Ceph RBD for volumes (Cinder)

objects_ceph.description: Configures RadosGW front end for Ceph RBD. This exposes S3 and Swift API Interfaces. If enabled, this option will prevent Swift from installing.
objects_ceph.label: Ceph RadosGW for objects (Swift API)

volumes_block_device.description: High performance block device storage. It is recommended to have at least one Cinder Block Device
volumes_block_device.label: Cinder Block device driver

ephemeral_ceph.description: Configures Nova to store ephemeral volumes in RBD. This works best if Ceph is enabled for volumes and images, too. Enables live migration of all types of Ceph backed VMs (without this option, live migration will only work with VMs launched from Cinder volumes).
ephemeral_ceph.label: Ceph RBD for ephemeral volumes (Nova)

volumes_lvm.description: It is recommended to have at least one Cinder node.
volumes_lvm.label: Cinder LVM over iSCSI for volumes

restrictions.message: Only one Glance backend could be selected.

images_vcenter.description: Configures Glance to use the vCenter/ESXi backend to store images. If enabled, this option will prevent Swift from installing.
images_vcenter.label: VMware vCenter/ESXi datastore for images (Glance)

osd_pool_size.description: Configures the default number of object replicas in Ceph. This number must be equal to or lower than the number of deployed 'Ceph OSD' nodes.
osd_pool_size.label: Ceph object replication factor

restrictions.settings:storage.images_vcenter.value ==: Only one Glance backend could be selected.

images_ceph.description: Configures Glance to use the Ceph RBD backend to store images. If enabled, this option will prevent Swift from installing.
images_ceph.label: Ceph RBD for images (Glance)

restrictions.settings:public_ssl.services.value == fa: TLS for OpenStack public endpoints should be enabled

horizon.description: Secure access to Horizon enabling HTTPS instead of HTTP
horizon.label: HTTPS for Horizon

services.description: Enable TLS termination on HAProxy for OpenStack services
services.label: TLS for OpenStack public endpoints

hostname.description: Your DNS entries should point to this name. Self-signed certificates also will use this hostname
hostname.label: DNS hostname for public TLS endpoints

cert_data.description: Certificate and private key data, concatenated into a single file
cert_data.label: Certificate

values.description: Generate private key and certificate that will be signed by this key
values.label: Self-signed
I have my own keypair with certificate

cert_source.description: From where we'll get certificate and private key
cert_source.label: Select source for certificate

murano_glance_artifacts_plugin.description: If selected glance artifact repository will be enabled
murano_glance_artifacts_plugin.label: Enable glance artifact repository

restrictions.message: Murano is not enabled on the Additional Components section

verified.description: Set True only if multicast is configured correctly on router.
verified.label: Need to pass network verification.

hosts_ip.description: IP Addresses of MongoDB. Use comma to split IPs
hosts_ip.label: MongoDB hosts IP

restrictions.message: Ceilometer and MongoDB are not enabled on the Additional Components section

assign_to_all_nodes.description: When disabled, public network will be assigned to controllers only
assign_to_all_nodes.label: Assign public network to all nodes

auto_assign_floating_ip.description: If selected, OpenStack will automatically assign a floating IP to a new instance
auto_assign_floating_ip.label: Auto assign floating IP

use_cow_images.description: For most cases you will want qcow format. If it's disabled, raw image format will be used to run VMs. OpenStack with raw format currently does not support snapshotting.
use_cow_images.label: Use qcow format for images

puppet_debug.description: Debug puppet logging mode provides more information, but requires more disk space.
puppet_debug.label: Puppet debug logging

values.description: Choose this type of hypervisor if you run OpenStack on hardware
values.label: KVM

values.description: Choose this type of hypervisor if you run OpenStack on virtual hosts.
values.label: QEMU

resume_guests_state_on_host_boot.description: Whether to resume previous guests state when the host reboots. If enabled, this option causes guests assigned to the host to resume their previous state. If the guest was running a restart will be attempted when nova-compute starts. If the guest was not running previously, a restart will not be attempted.
resume_guests_state_on_host_boot.label: Resume guests state on host boot

debug.description: Debug logging mode provides more information, but requires more disk space.
debug.label: OpenStack debug logging

nova_quota.description: Quotas are used to limit CPU and memory usage for tenants. Enabling quotas will increase load on the Nova database.
nova_quota.label: Nova quotas
